structure.unit: ESCAPE AND OTHER OFFENSES RELATING TO CUSTODY

text.section:
A person is guilty of attempting to escape from the penitentiary when he:
Conceals himself within the walls of the penitentiary; or
Attempts to scale the enclosure surrounding the penitentiary; or
Flees from whatever bounds he may be assigned, whether under guard or as a trusty; or
Escapes from a locked cell, dormitory, hospital or other lockup in the penitentiary; or
Escapes from one part of the penitentiary to another; or
Does any other act in furtherance of an escape from the penitentiary; or
Does any act or omission constituting criminal attempt under KRS 506.010.
Attempting to escape from the penitentiary is a Class D felony.
No penalty provision of KRS 506.010 shall apply to an offense committed under this section.

law.history: Amended 1984 Ky. Acts ch. 111, sec. 166, effective July 13, 1984. -- Created 1982 Ky. Acts ch. 405, sec. 2, effective July 15, 1982.
